page.title: 09FARMING - A LOCAL FARM.
page.content: {Mr.T.Morralee's RIDING FARM }is just one of the farms around Lumley. The 17th century farmhouse was part of the Lumley Castle Estate. The land was bought in the 1920's by the N.C.B. for coal production,but the present farmer is still a tenant of Lord Scarborough. The farm covers 250 acres, producing potatoes, turnips, wheat(100 acres for bread -goes to a Tyne mill), oilseed rape (profitable,and a good "cleaning" crop-sent to Rotterdam), and grass for silage.During the Winter,85 cows calve here, then move in Spring to a hill farm 18 miles away.There are also 550 ewes brought down from the hill farm in Spring to produce 830 lambs. The farmer begins work at 6.30 a.m. and he and three others work a 7-day week. He owns 8 tractors and finds the round baler invaluable. Our E.E.C.membership has been of benefit to him. {R.Taylor.
